title: Variables
text: Represent the number of each type of cash using variables. The number of $10 bills is twice the number of $5 bills, so you can represent $10 as 2f, and write five dollar bills as f.

title: Multiplication
text: Multiple the number of each cash type(in variable form) by its respective value.

title: Conversion
text: Now, translate the expressions that were multiplied by their cash values into a single equation. This will be $$125=20f+5f$$

title: Substitution
text: Plug f into the original relationship between the cash to find 2f.

title: Calculation
text: The answer is 10 $10 bills and 5 $5 bills.
